Name: Albert Einstein
Description: Developed the theory of relativity, revolutionizing physics.

Name: Marie Curie
Description: Pioneered research on radioactivity, becoming the first woman to win a Nobel Prize.

Name: Isaac Newton
Description: Formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation.

Name: Galileo Galilei
Description: Played a key role in the scientific revolution and improved the telescope.

Name: Charles Darwin
Description: Proposed the theory of evolution by natural selection.

Name: Nelson Mandela
Description: Fought against apartheid in South Africa and became its first black president.

Name: Mahatma Gandhi
Description: Led the Indian independence movement through nonviolent civil disobedience.

Name: Leonardo da Vinci
Description: Renaissance polymath known for contributions to art, science, and engineering.

Name: Cleopatra
Description: Last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, known for her intelligence and political acumen.

Name: Winston Churchill
Description: British Prime Minister during World War II, known for his leadership and speeches.

Name: Martin Luther King Jr.
Description: Civil rights leader known for his role in advancing civil rights using nonviolent civil disobedience.

Name: Ada Lovelace
Description: Considered the first computer programmer for her work on Charles Babbage's early mechanical general-purpose computer.

Name: Stephen Hawking
Description: Renowned theoretical physicist known for his work on black holes and cosmology.

Name: Alexander the Great
Description: Conqueror who created one of the largest empires in ancient history.

Name: Julius Caesar
Description: Roman general and statesman, pivotal in the events that led to the rise of the Roman Empire.

Name: Florence Nightingale
Description: Founder of modern nursing and a pioneer in healthcare reform.

Name: Thomas Edison
Description: Inventor known for the phonograph and the electric light bulb.

Name: Rosalind Franklin
Description: Key figure in the discovery of the structure of DNA.

Name: Malala Yousafzai
Description: Youngest Nobel Prize laureate for her activism in education rights.

Name: Nikola Tesla
Description: Inventor and electrical engineer known for his contributions to the development of alternating current (AC).

Name: Sigmund Freud
Description: Founder of psychoanalysis, known for his theories on the unconscious mind.

Name: Rosa Parks
Description: Civil rights activist whose refusal to give up her bus seat sparked the Montgomery Bus Boycott.

Name: Albert Schweitzer
Description: Philosopher and physician known for his humanitarian work and philosophy of 'reverence for life.'

Name: Marie Antoinette
Description: Last queen of France before the French Revolution, symbolizing royal excess.

Name: George Washington
Description: First President of the United States and a Founding Father.

Name: Emmeline Pankhurst
Description: Leader of the British suffragette movement, advocating for women's right to vote.

Name: Thomas Jefferson
Description: Principal author of the Declaration of Independence and third U.S. President.

Name: Catherine the Great
Description: Empress of Russia who expanded the empire and promoted the arts and education.

Name: Buddha
Description: Founder of Buddhism, teaching the path to enlightenment and compassion.

Name: Confucius
Description: Philosopher whose teachings emphasized ethics, morality, and social harmony.

Name: Socrates
Description: Classical Greek philosopher known for his contributions to ethics and epistemology.

Name: Plato
Description: Student of Socrates and author of works on philosophy and political theory.

Name: Friedrich Nietzsche
Description: Philosopher known for his critiques of traditional morality and religion.

Name: Jane Goodall
Description: Primatologist and anthropologist known for her studies of chimpanzees.

Name: Wangari Maathai
Description: Kenyan environmental activist and Nobel Peace Prize winner for her work in sustainable development.

Name: Stephen Jay Gould
Description: Paleontologist and evolutionary biologist known for his work on the theory of punctuated equilibrium.

Name: Charles Babbage
Description: Mathematician and inventor known as the 'father of the computer.'

Name: Bill Gates
Description: Co-founder of Microsoft and philanthropist focused on global health and education.

Name: Steve Jobs
Description: Co-founder of Apple Inc. and a key figure in personal computing and technology innovation.

Name: Angela Merkel
Description: German politician who served as Chancellor and was a key figure in European politics.

Name: Marie Kondo
Description: Japanese organizing consultant and author known for her KonMari method of decluttering.

Name: Amelia Earhart
Description: First female aviator to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean, a pioneer in aviation.

Name: Frida Kahlo
Description: Mexican painter known for her surrealist self-portraits and activism.

Name: Harriet Tubman
Description: Abolitionist and political activist who helped enslaved people escape to freedom.

Name: Neil Armstrong
Description: First person to walk on the moon during the Apollo 11 mission.

Name: Oprah Winfrey
Description: Media mogul, talk show host, and philanthropist known for her empowering influence.

Name: Malcom X
Description: African-American leader in the civil rights movement, known for his advocacy of black empowerment.

Name: Genghis Khan
Description: Founder of the Mongol Empire, one of the largest contiguous land empires in history.

Name: Mao Zedong
Description: Founding chairman of the Communist Party of China and leader of the Chinese Revolution.

Name: Fidel Castro
Description: Cuban revolutionary and politician who led the Cuban Revolution and served as Prime Minister.

Name: Simone de Beauvoir
Description: French existentialist philosopher and author known for her works on feminism.

Name: Simone Biles
Description: American gymnast who won a record-breaking seven Olympic medals.

Name: Serena Williams
Description: Professional tennis player known for her dominance in the sport and advocacy for equality.

Name: Muhammed Ali
Description: Professional boxer and activist known for his social and political activism.

Name: Marilyn Monroe
Description: American actress, model, and singer who became a cultural icon of the 1950s.

Name: Elvis Presley
Description: American singer and actor who became a cultural icon and influenced many musical genres.

Name: Michael Jackson
Description: American singer, songwriter, and dancer who is considered one of the most influential entertainers of all time.

Name: Princess Diana
Description: British royal and humanitarian known for her charitable work and fashion influence.

Name: Audrey Hepburn
Description: Belgian-born American actress and humanitarian known for her elegance and style.

Name: Coco Chanel
Description: French fashion designer who popularized the use of jersey fabric and created the Chanel suit.

Name: Galileo Galilei
Description: Italian astronomer and physicist who made significant contributions to the scientific revolution.

Name: Marie Curie
Description: Polish physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity.

Name: Albert Einstein
Description: German-born theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity.

Name: Charles Darwin
Description: English naturalist who proposed the theory of evolution by natural selection.

Name: Isaac Newton
Description: English mathematician, astronomer, and physicist who developed the laws of motion and universal gravitation.

Name: Aristotle
Description: Greek philosopher who made influential contributions to various branches of science.

Name: Plato
Description: Greek philosopher and student of Socrates who founded the first institution of higher learning in the Western world.

Name: Socrates
Description: Greek philosopher known as one of the founders of Western philosophy.

Name: Confucius
Description: Chinese philosopher and teacher whose teachings emphasized ethics, morality, and social harmony.

Name: Buddha
Description: Indian spiritual teacher and founder of Buddhism who taught the path to enlightenment.

Name: Jesus Christ
Description: Central figure of Christianity, whose life and teachings form the basis of the religion.

Name: Muhammad
Description: Arab religious and political leader who founded Islam and is considered the final prophet in a series of prophets.

Name: Martin Luther
Description: German professor of theology who initiated the Protestant Reformation.

Name: Galileo Galilei
Description: Italian astronomer and physicist who made significant contributions to the scientific revolution.

Name: Leonardo da Vinci
Description: Italian polymath who made contributions to art, science, and engineering during the Renaissance.

Name: William Shakespeare
Description: English poet and playwright considered one of the greatest writers in the English language.

Name: Ludwig van Beethoven
Description: German composer and pianist who composed some of the most influential works in classical music.

Name: Vincent van Gogh
Description: Dutch post-impressionist painter known for his unique style and influential works.

Name: Pablo Picasso
Description: Spanish painter and sculptor who co-founded the Cubist movement and is considered one of the most influential artists of the 20th century.

Name: Nelson Mandela
Description: South African anti-apartheid activist and politician who served as President of South Africa.

Name: John Locke
Description: English philosopher who laid the groundwork for modern democratic theory and liberalism.

Name: Thomas Hobbes
Description: English philosopher known for his social contract theory and views on human nature.

Name: Voltaire
Description: French Enlightenment writer known for his advocacy of civil liberties and separation of church and state.

Name: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
Description: Genevan philosopher whose ideas on democracy and education influenced modern political thought.

Name: Mary Wollstonecraft
Description: Early advocate for women's rights and author of 'A Vindication of the Rights of Woman.'

Name: Frederick Douglass
Description: Abolitionist and social reformer who escaped slavery and became a prominent activist.

Name: Susan B. Anthony
Description: Leader in the women's suffrage movement in the United States.

Name: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
Description: Associate Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court known for her work on gender equality and civil rights.

Name: Barack Obama
Description: 44th President of the United States and the first African American to hold the office.

Name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Description: 32nd President of the United States who led the country during the Great Depression and World War II.

Name: Margaret Thatcher
Description: First female Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, known for her strong conservative policies.

Name: Angela Merkel
Description: Chancellor of Germany who played a key role in European politics and economic stability.

Name: Indira Gandhi
Description: First and only female Prime Minister of India, known for her central role in Indian politics.

Name: Golda Meir
Description: First and only female Prime Minister of Israel, known for her leadership during the Yom Kippur War.

Name: Cesar Chavez
Description: Labor leader and civil rights activist who fought for the rights of farmworkers.

Name: Nelson Mandela
Description: Anti-apartheid revolutionary and political leader who became South Africa's first black president.

Name: Desmond Tutu
Description: South African Anglican bishop and social rights activist known for his work against apartheid.

Name: Aung San Suu Kyi
Description: Burmese politician and Nobel laureate known for her pro-democracy efforts.

Name: Vladimir Lenin
Description: Leader of the Bolshevik Party and key figure in the Russian Revolution.

Name: Winston Churchill
Description: British Prime Minister known for his leadership during World War II.
